sources.title: Thunder Over Texas (1934) BIG BOY WILLIAMS
sources.description:
Movie Class by PizzaFLIX: Guin Williams (1889-1962) was nicknamed "Big Boy" as he was 6' 2" and had a muscular build. Williams made his screen debut in 1919 and was a busy work actor with 220 appearances. His last role was in John Wayne's THE COMANCHEROS (1961), He died the following year unexpectedly of uremic poisoning age 63.

Stars: Guinn 'Big Boy' Williams, Marion Shilling, Helen Westcott 
Director: Edgar G. Ulmer (as John Warner)

A cowboy must protect a young girl from the evil men who murdered her father for a valuable map they believed he possessed.

metadata.Plot: After her father is killed by the local banker in a struggle over some valuable railroad maps, Tiny is adopted by cowboy Ted Wright. As Ted cares for the little girl, the banker and a crooked sheriff make repeated attempts to steal the maps, which contain information concerning the location of new railroad lines, but are thwarted by the cowboy. Finally, Tiny is kidnapped by a cohort of the banker and the sheriff. A posse pursues the kidnapper and eventually rescues Tiny.
metadata.Actors: Guinn 'Big Boy' Williams, Marion Shilling, Helen Westcott
